policy: ALL tasks and subtasks contained within this blueprint MUST be completed in their entirety. Deferring, skipping, or omitting any part of the plan is strictly prohibited. Every unit defined here represents a mandatory component of the final delivery. 'Effective test coverage' means covering ALL code paths, edge cases, and error conditions - not just line coverage. This includes unreachable paths, error branches, and platform-specific code.

coverageDefinition.effectiveCoverage: Coverage of all logic paths, error branches, edge cases, and platform-specific code. Must handle null/undefined inputs, error propagation, concurrent access, and boundary conditions.

targetMetrics.errorPathCoverage: 100% not inclusive of TRULY unreachable code i.e. invariant assertions

eventloopModule.confidence: HIGH - Extensively tested and reviewed, only coverage gaps remain

gojaEventloopModule.confidence: HIGH - Re-verified with CHANGE_GROUP_B, no regressions, only coverage gaps remain

logicalChunks.title: Eventloop Core & Promise System
logicalChunks.description: The primary eventloop implementation including loop.go, promise.go, js.go, poller implementations, metrics, state management, timer pool, and all alternate implementations. This is the core feature implementation containing the most recent changes.

reviewCycleTasks.title: LOGICAL_CHUNK_2 Initial Review
reviewCycleTasks.description: Ensure, or rather GUARANTEE the correctness of the Eventloop Core & Promise System vs main branch. Since you're _guaranteeing_ it, sink commensurate effort; you care deeply about keeping your word, after all. Even then, I expect you to think very VERY hard, significantly harder than you might expect. Assume, from start to finish, that there's _always_ another problem, and you just haven't caught it yet. Question all information provided - _only_ if it is simply impossible to verify are you allowed to trust, and if you trust you MUST specify that (as briefly as possible). Provide a succinct summary then more detailed analysis. Your succinct summary must be such that removing any single part, or applying any transformation or adjustment of wording, would make it materially worse. Write up your review to ./eventloop/docs/reviews/<SEQUENCE>-<IDENTIFIER>.md.

subtasks.title: Critical Issue Found
subtasks.description: Timer pool memory leak on cancellation path at loop.go:1429

reviewCycleTasks.changesToReview: Eventloop Core & Promise System vs main

Use runSubagent to execute fixes comprehensively.

testCoverageTasks.title: Achieve 100% Effective Test Coverage - Eventloop Module (LOGICAL_CHUNK_2)
testCoverageTasks.description: Achieve 100% effective test coverage for eventloop module. Current coverage: 77.1% main, 69.3% alternateone, 58.0% alternatethree, 73.0% alternatetwo. REQUIREMENTS: (1) All code paths covered, (2) All error branches tested, (3) All edge cases covered, (4) Platform-specific code tested where possible, (5) Race condition coverage with -race flag. TARGET METRICS: main >= 90%, alternateone >= 90%, alternatethree >= 85% (experimental), alternatetwo >= 90%.

verification.command: go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop/... && go tool cover -func=coverage.out | grep total

subtasks.title: Add tests for main package Promise Combinators and JS Integration
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive tests for Promise combinators (All, Race, AllSettled, Any) - currently 0% coverage. Also test JS Promise Integration (ThenWithJS, thenStandalone) - currently 0% coverage. These are CRITICAL gaps identified in COVERAGE_1.1 analysis. Estimated gain: +8-13% coverage. Test files: promise_combinators_test.go, promise_js_integration_test.go.

coverageAnalysis.metrics: All new tests pass with -race detector (zero data races)

verification.coverageAnalysis: go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop && go tool cover -func=coverage.out | grep total

nextSteps: COVERAGE_1.3: Add tests for alternatethree Promise Core and error paths (estimated +15-20%)
Target remaining gap: 5.9% to reach 90% coverage
Focus areas: Registry Scavenge, Poll error handling, State machine queries

subtasks.title: Add tests for alternatethree Promise Core and error paths
subtasks.description: Based on COVERAGE_1.1 analysis, add tests for: (1) alternatethree Promise Core (Resolve, Reject, fanOut, NewPromise) - currently 0%, gain +15-20% coverage, (2) Registry Scavenge/Compaction - currently 13.8%/0%, gain +5% coverage, (3) Error paths (handlePollError) - currently 0%, gain +2% coverage, (4) State machine queries (IsTerminal, CanAcceptWork, TransitionAny) - currently 0%, gain +3-4% coverage. Test files: promise_alternatethree_test.go, registry_scavenge_test.go, poll_error_test.go, state_machine_test.go.
priorityAreas: Registry Scavenge with weak pointer GC

subtasks.title: Verify 90%+ effective coverage achieved
subtasks.description: Run full coverage analysis: 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop/... && go tool cover -html=coverage.out -o coverage.html'. Verify target metrics: main >= 90%, alternateone >= 90%, alternatethree >= 85%, alternatetwo >= 90%. Ensure all identified coverage gaps closed.

testCoverageTasks.title: Achieve 100% Effective Test Coverage - Goja-Eventloop Module (LOGICAL_CHUNK_1)
testCoverageTasks.description: Achieve 100% effective test coverage for goja-eventloop module. Current coverage: 74.9%. REQUIREMENTS: (1) All code paths covered, (2) All error branches tested, (3) Promise combinator edge cases (null/undefined inputs), (4) Timer ID boundary cases (MAX_SAFE_INTEGER), (5) Concurrent timer scheduling stress tests, (6) Deep promise chain scenarios (>10 .then() calls). TARGET METRICS: main >= 90%.

verification.command: go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./goja-eventloop/... && go tool cover -func=coverage.out | grep total

subtasks.title: Analyze coverage gaps in goja-eventloop (74.9%)
subtasks.description: Run 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./goja-eventloop/...' and 'go tool cover -html=coverage.out' to identify specific uncovered lines. Document all gaps in ./goja-eventloop/docs/coverage-gaps.md.

subtasks.title: Add Promise combinator edge case tests
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive tests for Promise combinators (all, race, allSettled, any) covering: null inputs, undefined inputs, empty arrays, single element arrays, nested promises, mixed resolution/rejection scenarios. Test file: adapter_combinators_edge_test.go

subtasks.title: Add timer ID boundary tests
subtasks.description: Create tests for timer ID boundaries: MAX_SAFE_INTEGER, overflow scenarios, ID reuse edge cases, concurrent timer scheduling with high IDs. Test file: adapter_timer_boundary_test.go

subtasks.title: Add deep promise chain tests
subtasks.description: Create tests for deep promise chains: 10+ .then() calls, mixed resolution/rejection in chains, Promise.all with nested promises, error propagation in complex chains. Test file: adapter_deep_chain_test.go

subtasks.title: Verify 90%+ effective coverage achieved
subtasks.description: Run full coverage analysis: 'go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./goja-eventloop/... && go tool cover -html=coverage.out -o coverage.html'. Verify target metric: main >= 90%. Ensure all identified coverage gaps closed including error paths and edge cases.

betteralignTasks.title: Create custom config.mk target for betteralign
betteralignTasks.description: Add a custom target in config.mk for running betteralign on eventloop module. TARGET: 'betteralign-eventloop' with command: 'go -C eventloop tool betteralign -apply .'. This should automatically apply betteralign fixes for cache line padding optimization.
betteralignTasks.notes: Target already existed in config.mk. Enhanced with proper logging to build.log per operational discipline.

subtasks.title: Create/edit config.mk with betteralign target
Add betteralign target to Makefile integration
subtasks.description: Verify that betteralign-eventloop target is accessible via Makefile. Ensure it integrates with existing build targets.

betteralignTasks.title: Run betteralign on eventloop module
betteralignTasks.description: Execute the betteralign target using #make tool with custom target defined in config.mk. Command: 'make betteralign-eventloop'. Pipe output to build.log as per operational discipline.

findings.summary: Betteralign completed successfully with NO CHANGES REQUIRED. All cache line padding optimizations verified correct.
findings.reason: Existing manual cache line padding and betteralign:ignore directives prevent any necessary automatic changes.
details: All hot data structures manually aligned for cache line optimization
Mutex fields separated from hot fields

betteralignTasks.title: Verify cache line padding is sane after betteralign
betteralignTasks.description: After betteralign applies changes, verify that cache line padding is still correct and doesn't introduce false sharing. REQUIREMENTS: (1) Check that hot data structures remain properly padded, (2) Verify no struct size changes that would affect cache line alignment, (3) Run stress tests to ensure no performance regression, (4) Check that betteralign didn't add excessive padding that wastes memory. VERIFICATION: 'make test' with benchmark comparison. Document any structural changes in ./eventloop/docs/betteralign-verification.md.

subtasks.title: Review betteralign changes
subtasks.description: Use 'git diff' to see what betteralign changed. Look for: struct field reordering, padding additions, size changes. Verify changes are minimal and targeted for cache line optimization.
subtasks.results: No changes made by betteralign (expected - BETTERALIGN_2 already confirmed no changes required)

subtasks.title: Run stress tests to verify no performance regression
subtasks.description: Run 'make test -run Stress' and compare benchmarks before/after betteralign. Look for latency changes, throughput changes, or unexpected performance degradation.
subtasks.results: All benchmarks stable (137s testing). No false sharing detected. 2,617,370 concurrent operations with zero losses.

subtasks.title: Document verification results
subtasks.description: Create ./eventloop/docs/betteralign-verification.md documenting: (a) Changes made by betteralign, (b) Performance metrics comparison, (c) Cache line padding verification, (d) Conclusion on whether padding is still sane.
subtasks.summary: Comprehensive verification report covering alignment tests, benchmarks, false sharing analysis, and platform-specific verification.

continuousVerificationTasks.title: Run make-all-with-log CONTINUOUSLY
continuousVerificationTasks.description: Run 'make all' with full logging output after every significant change to ensure builds remain stable. Target: build.log. COMMAND: 'make all 2>&1 | fold -w 200 | tee build.log | tail -n 15'. This is a CONTINUOUS task - must be run after: (a) Each code change, (b) Each test addition, (c) Each review cycle completion, (d) Each bug fix. FAIL POLICY: If ANY test fails, STOP. Do not proceed. Fix the issue immediately. Zero tolerance for test failures, even due to timing or non-determinism.

verificationHistory.notes: Baseline verification before review cycles. All packages built, vetted, staticchecked, betteraligned, and tested successfully.
